pull.title: guix: build for Linux HOSTS with `-static-libgcc`

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33181.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [theuni](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33181#issuecomment-3201253439) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#33537](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33537) ([wip] A more static bitcoin-qt by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

Concept ACK.

But note that this may require some care when we start shipping the kernel, as it likely needs to be built against a shared libgcc (and maybe libstdc++, depending on what our api/abi looks like at that point).

Maybe add a note so we don't forget?

> Maybe add a note so we don't forget?

Any preference to where we add that?
@theuni switched this to using `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS`, which should make it clearer which flags are being used for executables.

Switching to `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS` came out of an offline discussion with fanquake.

@fanquake we want all flags passed to all binaries with the exception of `-static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc`, which should only go to exe's.

So I think we want:
`HOST_LDFLAGS="-Wl,--as-needed -Wl,--dynamic-linker=$glibc_dynamic_linker -Wl,-O2"`
`CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="-static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc"`

Then for CMake, still pass `LDFLAGS` via `HOST_LDFLAGS` in addition to `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS`. That way exe's will (should?) end up with both.
Yea, I need to rework this in any case, as the macOS build breaks with the changes here.

guix: move static-libc++ into CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS flags

Make it clearer that we are only applying this to executables.

events.message:
guix: move static-libc++ into CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS flags

Make it clearer that we are only applying this to executables.

verification.payload:
tree 249aa5fa4412c81c0f2bf676b9f8014f24687cb4
parent 81fe5cf9757e0245a590869d758ded2860f765b9
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1755010988 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1759502652 +0100

guix: build for Linux HOSTS with -static-libgcc

events.message: guix: build for Linux HOSTS with -static-libgcc

comments.body: Hmm, is it necessary for `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS` to also contain `HOST_LDFLAGS`? I would have expected CMake to use both for exe's.
I couldn't find a way to pass these through, without it, without the build breaking in one way or another.
